text: GA can form two epimers: -GA and -GA ( Figure 3 ). -GA is derived from -GA by isomerization, and theand -forms differ only in their C 18 -H-, trans-, and cisconfiguration, respectively. Some scholars examined their distribution characteristics in rat tissue and found that the concentrations of -GA in the liver and duodenum were significantly higher than those of -GA after i.v. administration. However, the concentrations of -GA in the other tissues were lower than or similar to those of -GA and declined rapidly. This indicates that the protective and antiinflammatory effects of -GA on the liver may be better than those of -GA [20] .
